snippet: The trial of Pedro Espada Jr., a former state senator, promises to be as much about politics as about fraudulent accounting.
abstract: Former New York State Sen Pedro Espada Jr is set to stand trial on charges that he and son Pedro Gautier Espada diverted hundreds of thousands of dollars from nonprofit Bronx health clinic Soundview Health Care Network for their own benefit; both men face a maximum of 10 years in prison and a fine of $250,000 for each count on which they are convicted.
lead_paragraph: The trial of Pedro Espada Jr., a former state senator, promises to be as much about politics as about fraudulent accounting.

headline.seo: Trial Begins for Pedro Espada, Accused of Looting Health Care Network
headline.main: In Espada Fraud Trial, a Focus on Politics and Lavish Spending
headline.print_headline: In Espada Fraud Trial, a Focus on Politics and Lavish Spending
